page.title: 07Landscape Around World's End
page.content: Much of the countryside was devoted to farming, the main crops being wheat and barley. There are abut 8 farms in the area and this includes the only cattle and pig farm. Even though there were some woods in the area, forestry did not seem like a major industry. However there was some forestry near Bradley Court. Also in these woods are the remains of a motte and bailey castle. Twenty years ago there was a railway from Hampstead Norreys to Didcot. The M4 runs through the South of the area and the A34 through the West. These can be inconvenient as they sometimes split a field in two.
